text.0: i am the royal ruler mine is empire as mine who sway all life are all immortals.
text.1: varuṇas will the gods obey and follow i am the king of mens most lofty cover.
text.2: i am king varuṇa to me were given these first existing high celestial powers.
text.3: varuṇas will the gods obey and follow i am the king of mens most lofty cover.
text.4: i varuṇa am indra in their greatness these the two wide deep fairlyfashioned regions.
text.5: these the two worldhalves have i even as tvaṣṭar knowing all beings joined and held together.
text.6: i made to flow the moistureshedding waters and set the heaven firm in the scat of order.
text.7: by law the son of aditi law observer hath spread abroad the world in threefold measure.
text.8: heroes with noble horses fain for battle selected warriors call on me in combat.
text.9: i indra maghavan excite the conflict i stir the dust lord of surpassing vigour.
text.10: all this i did the gods own conquering power never impedeth me whom none opposeth.
text.11: when lauds and soma juice have made me joyful both the unbounded regions are affrighted.
text.12: all beings know these deeds of thine thou tellest this unto varuṇa thou great disposer.
text.13: thou art renowned as having slain the vṛtras thou madest flow the floods that were obstructed.
text.14: our fathers then were these the seven his what time the son of durgaha was captive.
text.15: for her they gained by sacrifice trasadasyu a demigod like indra conquering foemen.
text.16: the spouse of purukutsa gave oblations to you o indravaruṇa with homage.
text.17: then unto her ye gave king trasadasyu the demigod the slayer of the foeman.
text.18: may we possessing much delight in riches gods in oblations and the kine in pasture.
text.19: and that milchcow who shrinks not from the milking o indravaruṇa give to us daily.
